response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose of this Act is to provide communities the opportunity to protest the renewal of certain liquor licenses. [CHUNK_4] This bill amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to apply to both the issuance of new liquor licenses, and the renewal of existing liquor licenses, for on-site sale and consumption by the drink. [CHUNK_5] The description provides that the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county shall deny the renewal of certain current liquor licenses upon receipt of sufficient protests. [CHUNK_8]",
  "appropriations": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any information regarding appropriations. [CHUNK_0]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding assumptions and methodology for any fiscal impact. [CHUNK_0]",
  "agency_impact": "The measure provides that the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county shall deny the renewal of certain current liquor licenses upon receipt of sufficient protests. [CHUNK_8] This will affect proceedings for license renewals that are begun after the Act's effective date. [CHUNK_6]",
  "economic_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "policy_impact": "This Act amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which currently applies only to the issuance of new liquor licenses, but not the renewal of current licenses. [CHUNK_2] The legislature finds this creates a safe harbor for existing establishments seeking a renewal of their liquor license. [CHUNK_3] This bill amends the statute so that it shall apply to both the issuance of new liquor licenses and the renewal of existing liquor licenses. [CHUNK_5]",
  "revenue_sources": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any information regarding revenue sources for this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any information regarding the operating revenue impact of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any information regarding the capital expenditure impact of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any information regarding the fiscal implications of this measure after six years. [CHUNK_0]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "No previous fiscal note was provided for comparison. [CHUNK_0]"
}

  "overview": "The purpose of this Act is to provide communities the opportunity to protest the renewal of certain liquor licenses. [CHUNK_4] This bill amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to apply to both the issuance of new liquor licenses, and the renewal of existing liquor licenses, for on-site sale and consumption by the drink. [CHUNK_5] The description provides that the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county shall deny the renewal of certain current liquor licenses upon receipt of sufficient protests. [CHUNK_8] This will affect proceedings for license renewals that are begun after the Act's effective date. [CHUNK_6]",
  "economic_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "policy_impact": "This Act amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which currently applies only to the issuance of new liquor licenses, but not the renewal of current licenses. [CHUNK_2] The legislature finds this creates a safe harbor for existing establishments seeking a renewal of their liquor license. [CHUNK_3] This bill amends the statute so that it shall apply to both the issuance of new liquor licenses and the renewal of existing liquor licenses. [CHUNK_5]",

  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any information regarding the fiscal implications of this measure after six years. [CHUNK_0]",

chunk_details.chunk_text: HB2 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 2 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 STATE OF HAWAII A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO LIQUOR LICENSES . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. The legislature finds that patrons leaving a liquor establishment can adversely affect neighboring residents

patrons leaving a liquor establishment can adversely affect neighboring residents and users of nearby public facilities. The legislature enacted section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which allows for the denial or restriction of liquor licenses for certain establishments near schools or parks, to promote an environment in which alcohol imbibing patrons

parks, to promote an environment in which alcohol imbibing patrons do not interfere with minors or other residents. The legislature further finds that section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, currently applies only to the issuance of new liquor licenses, but not the renewal of current licenses, thus creating a safe harbor

the renewal of current licenses, thus creating a safe harbor for existing establishments seeking a renewal of their liquor license. Although registered voters within five hundred feet of a liquor establishment may not be inclined to protest the initial issuance of a liquor license, they may wish to do so

of a liquor license, they may wish to do so when the license becomes subject to renewal and they have learned more about the establishment. Accordingly, the purpose of this Act is to provide communities the opportunity to protest the renewal of certain liquor licenses. SECTION 2 . Section 281-39.5,

renewal of certain liquor licenses. SECTION 2 . Section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by amending subsection (b) to read as follows: "(b) This section shall apply [ only ] to both the issuance of new liquor licenses , and the renewal of existing liquor licenses, for on-site sale

and the renewal of existing liquor licenses, for on-site sale and consumption by the drink [ and not to any renewal of such licenses ]." SECTION 3. This Act does not affect rights and duties that matured, penalties that were incurred, and proceedings that were begun before its effective date.

incurred, and proceedings that were begun before its effective date. SECTION 4. Statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken. New statutory material is underscored. SECTION 5. This Act shall take effect upon its approval. INTRODUCED BY: _____________________________ Report Title: Liquor Licenses; Renewal; Protest; Denial Description: Provides that the

Title: Liquor Licenses; Renewal; Protest; Denial Description: Provides that the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county shall deny the renewal of certain current liquor licenses upon receipt of sufficient protests.
